definition: to sit astride/to ride (a horse, bike etc)/classifier for saddle horses
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Sometimes riders urge their horses on with whips.
sentences.chinese: 骑马的人有时用鞭子策马前进。

sentences.english: The horse answered to its rider's touch.
sentences.chinese: 马对骑马人的轻击做出了反应。

sentences.english: They rode over to see us last week.
sentences.chinese: 上星期他们骑马来探望我们。

sentences.english: She has journeyed on horseback through Africa and Turkey.
sentences.chinese: 她骑马旅行，穿过了非洲和土耳其。

sentences.english: Horseback riding and falconry popular pastimes.
sentences.chinese: 最受人喜爱的消遣是骑马和放鹰狩猎。

sentences.english: The rider asked the corporal why he was not helping.
sentences.chinese: 骑马人问下士为什么不去帮忙。

sentences.english: I didn't know that I was going to ride, and that it would be night.
sentences.chinese: 我哪儿知道要骑马，又要走到三更半夜呢。

sentences.english: After riding, he sluiced out his horse with water from a hose.
That rider has a good seat.
Palestinians ride horses on the beach of Gaza City on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 巴勒星期五，巴基斯坦人在加沙城的海滩上骑马。

sentences.english: They rode out to the mountains early in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 他们一大早就骑马进山了。
骑士们骑马比武，嬉戏作乐。

sentences.english: Reeve was paralyzed in a horseback riding accident in 1995.
sentences.chinese: 里夫在1995年骑马事故中受伤瘫痪。

sentences.english: He bought new saddling for the horse race.
sentences.chinese: 骑马比赛，他又买了副新的鞍欣。

sentences.english: The soldier rode on, with blood flowing from his right side.
sentences.chinese: 士兵骑马继续跑着，鲜血从右肋流了下来。

sentences.english: And all gazed eagerly at the little group of horsemen.
sentences.chinese: 大家都贪婪地望那一群骑马的人。

definition: to sit astride/to ride (a horse, bike etc)/classifier for saddle horses
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
to break in a horse/a trained saddle horse
